executable.title: Models
executable.description: This module is used for changing the appearance of and organizing 3d surface models.
executable.contributor: Julien Finet (Kitware), Alex Yarmarkovich (Isomics), Nicole Aucoin (SPL, BWH)

parameter.label: Scene tree view
parameter.description: The tree view of all models and model hierarchies in the current MRML scene. You can right click on the Scene element to add hierarchies and drag and drop models into them. Control the Visible property of the model via the eye icon (open/close to show/hide the models). The model color and opacity are also displayed on the same line as the model name. Model hierarchies allow you to group together models. When using the ModelMaker module, multiple models created from one label map are grouped under a model hierarchy node.

parameter.label: Information
parameter.description: Information about this surface model

parameter.label: Surface Area
parameter.description: The calculated surface area of the model, in square millimetres

parameter.label: Volume
parameter.description: The volume inside the surface model, in cubed millimetres

parameter.label: Number of Points
parameter.description: Number of vertices in the surface model

parameter.label: Number of Cells
parameter.description: Number of cells in the surface model

parameter.label: Number of Point Scalars
parameter.description: Shows how many arrays of scalars are associated with the points of the surface model.

parameter.label: Number of Cell Scalars
parameter.description: Shows how many arrays of scalars are associated with the cells of the surface model.

parameter.label: Filename
parameter.description: Path to the file which this surface model was loaded from/saved to

parameters.label: Display
parameters.description: Control the display properties of the currently selected model in the Scene

parameters.label: Visibility
parameters.description: Control the visibility of the model

parameter.label: Visible
parameter.description: Is this surface model visible in the 3D view?

parameter.label: Clip
parameter.description: Is clipping (using the slice planes) enabled for this model? Once it is on, go to the Clipping pane to set the options.

parameter.label: Slice Intersections Visible
parameter.description: If this flag is set, the intersections of the model with the slices will be computed and shown as an outline on the slice planes.

parameter.label: Slice Intersections Thickness
parameter.description: Width in pixels of the intersection lines of the model with the slice planes.

parameters.label: Representation
parameters.description: Control the representation of the model.

parameter.label: Representation
parameter.description: Control the surface geometry representation (points, wireframe or surface) for the object. Surface by default. Note that you can change the representation of all the models to wireframe with the 'w' key shortcut in the 3D view.

parameter.label: Point Size
parameter.description: Set the diameter of the model points (if the model is a point cloud or representation is "points".) The size is expressed in screen units. 1.0 by default.

parameter.label: Line Width
parameter.description: Set the width of the model lines (if the model is a polyline or representation is "wireframe"). The width is expressed in screen units. 1.0 by default.

parameter.label: Frontface culling
parameter.description: Turn on/off culling of polygons based on orientation of normal with respect to camera. If frontface culling is on, polygons facing towards camera are not drawn. Visible by default.

parameter.label: Backface culling
parameter.description: Turn on/off culling of polygons based on orientation of normal with respect to camera. If backface culling is on, polygons facing away from camera are not drawn. This feature needs to be turned off if the inside of a model is viewed, either when clipping or when moving the camera inside an object. Hidden by default.

parameters.label: Color
parameters.description: Control the colors of the model.

parameter.label: Color
parameter.description: Control the color of the model. Note that the lighting can alter the color. Gray by default.

parameter.label: Opacity
parameter.description: Control the opacity of the model. 1.0 is totally opaque and 0.0 is completely transparent. 1.0 by default.

parameter.label: Edge Visibility
parameter.description: Turn on/off the visibility of the model edges (the wireframe). Hidden by default

parameter.label: Edge Color
parameter.description: Control the color of the model edges (if Edge Visibility is enabled). Black by default.

parameters.label: Lighting
parameters.description: Control the lighting effects on the model.

parameter.label: Lighting
parameter.description: Control whether the model representation is impacted is by the frontfacing light. If enabled, Ambient, Diffuse and Specular parameters are used to compute the lighting effect. Enabled by default.

parameter.label: Interpolation
parameter.description: Control the shading interpolation method (Flat, Gouraud, Phong) for the model. Gouraud by default.

parameter.label: Shading
parameter.description: Control the shading of the model. The material properties must be set if enabled.

parameters.label: Material Properties
parameters.description: Material properties of the currently selected model

parameter.label: Ambient
parameter.description: Controls the base lighting for the model.

parameter.label: Diffuse
parameter.description: Controls the amount of light scattered from the model.

parameter.label: Specular
parameter.description: Controls the highlights on the model.

parameter.label: Power
parameter.description: The specular power.

parameter.label: Preview
parameter.description: A rendering of a sphere using the current material properties, useful if the surface model isn't regular.

string-enumeration.label: Presets
string-enumeration.description: A set of buttons allowing the user to select a new material properties from a set of defaults.
string-enumeration.element: Full ambient eliminating all directional shading

parameter.label: Scalars panel
parameter.description: Scalar overlay properties

parameter.label: Visible
parameter.description: Are the scalars visible on the surface model?

parameter.label: Active Scalar
parameter.description: A drop down menu listing the current scalar overlays associated with this model and shows which one is currently active. Most models will have normals, Freesurfer surface models can have multiple scalar overlay files associated with them (e.g. lh.sulc, lh.curv).

parameter.label: Color Table
parameter.description: Select a color look up table used to map the scalar overlay's values (usually in the range of 0.0 to 1.0) to colors. There are built in color maps that can be browsed in the Colors module. The most commonly used color map for FreeSurfer scalar overlays is the GreenRed one. Legacy color maps from Slicer2 include Grey, Iron, Rainbow, etc. Those color maps with "labels" in their names are usually discrete and don't work well for the continuous scalar overlay ranges.

parameter.label: Clipping
parameter.description: Control the clipping properties for this surface model

string-enumeration.label: Clipping Type
string-enumeration.description: When more than one slice plane is used, this option controls if it's the union or intersection of the positive and/or negative spaces that is used to clip the model. The parts of the model inside the selected space is kept, parts outside of the selection are clipped away.

string-enumeration.label: Red Slice Clipping
string-enumeration.description: Use the positive or negative space defined by the Red slice plane to clip the model. Positive side is toward the Superior, negative is toward the Inferior. Keeps the part of the model in the selected space, clips away the rest.

string-enumeration.label: Yellow Slice Clipping
string-enumeration.description: Use the positive or negative space defined by the Yellow slice plane to clip the model. Positive side is toward the Right, negative is toward the Left. Keeps the part of the model in the selected space, clips away the rest.

string-enumeration.label: Green Slice Clipping
string-enumeration.description: Use the positive or negative space defined by the Green slice plane to clip the model. Positive side is toward the Anterior, negative is toward the Posterior. Keeps the part of the model in the selected space, clips away the rest.
